result.execSummary:
The defendant Immanuel W McCarty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber release privileges for school. No electronic monitoring

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Court costs and victim witness surcharges are to be paid during term of probation; non-payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at $0.
COURT ALLOWS FOR EXPUNGEMENT IF DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES ALL TERMS OF PROBATION

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
- Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
- No Contact with Bradley T.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Immanuel W McCarty

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Immanuel W McCarty in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 1/2 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive with any other with Huber release privileges for school.  No electronic monitoring.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with Bradley T.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes all terms of probation

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Immanuel W McCarty in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however Branch 21 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Immanuel W McCarty not in court, in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defendant in custody at Vel Phillips Juvenile Justice Center.
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case is adjourned to Branch 21, Judge Brash.  

  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Immanuel W McCarty in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Immanuel W McCarty in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm. in Branch PE.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
